intro: Portlandia domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican portlandia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest undergrowth, and prefers well-drained soil. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
